sentences.english: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
sentences.chinese: 人在幼年負軛，這原是好的。

sentences.english: But there are tens of thousands other baby seals who are not as lucky as Shammy.
sentences.chinese: 而十多萬只幼年海豹卻不曾如此幸運。

sentences.english: The junior and senior of the senate all have driver's licenses.
sentences.chinese: 商討院的年父老以及幼年者都有駕駛執照。

sentences.english: He was very ill as a child and was considered delicate thereafter.
sentences.chinese: 他幼年多病，而後一向被人認爲弱不禁風。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the clinical characteristics of juvenile dermatomyositis (JDM).
sentences.chinese: 目的探討幼年型皮肌炎的臨牀特點。

sentences.english: A wild baby snow leopard has been caught on camera.
sentences.chinese: 山地攝影機抓拍到一隻野生幼年雪豹的影像。

sentences.english: The tiny skull belonged to a young Heterodontosaurus.
sentences.chinese: 這人小型頭骨屬於一隻幼年畸齒龍。

sentences.english: Because the LORD has been witness Between you and the wife of your youth, With whom you have dealt treacherously;
sentences.chinese: 因耶和華在你和你幼年所娶的妻中間作見證。

sentences.english: When my son was in second grade I was the leader of his Cub Scout Den.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子二年級的時候我成了他們幼年童子軍的領隊人。

sentences.english: Juvenile polyposis syndrome is a rare hamartomatous disorder.
sentences.chinese: 幼年型息肉症是很罕見的缺陷瘤。

sentences.english: During the four years since his puppyhood he had lived the life of a sated aristocrat;
sentences.chinese: 從幼年開始他已經過了四年養尊處優的貴族生活。

sentences.english: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
sentences.chinese: 你按罪狀刑罰我，又使我擔當幼年的罪孽。

sentences.english: the junior and senior of the senate all have driver's licenses.
sentences.chinese: 商討院的年父老和幼年者都有駕駛執照。

sentences.english: It was diagnosed as juvenile hyaline fibromatosis.
sentences.chinese: 幼年透明蛋白纖維瘤病。

sentences.english: These men shared more than just a birthday, the loss of a mother in childhood and a date with immortality.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩個同一天出生，都幼年喪母，而且都永垂不朽。

definition: to be orphaned of one's father
to be orphaned of one's father
to grow to adulthood/fully grown/the whole year
to have lost both one's parents
to come down in the world (idiom)/to suffer a reversal of fortune
